channel.title: Holidays: Wonderful Time or Death Trap?
channel.description:
The holidays are indeed a wonderful time for many, some it may not be for the gifts on Christmas and some it may be only for the gifts on Christmas, but I'm all about the family time.
We all know that one of the main things about the Holidays is the food; the wonderful ham and turkey and assortments of other types of food, varies from person to person.
But are the holidays really a 'Wonderful Time' or are they a 'Death Trap'?
I've noticed for the last couple of years that every year at Thanksgiving, our family would get together and we'd chow down on the food that my Aunt and her son's wife would prepare, but once we finished our plates and our stomachs were certainly full, we'd turn right back around and say "oh well, one more bite", which in turn normally leads to another full bloody plate.
The same thing happens at Christmas time, I personally watched my cousin put away 3 whole fucking plates, of course he's one of the lucky bastards and can eat whatever and not gain a pound.
So, I figured I'd ask all of you, what are your thoughts on this? Anyone else noticed this, or is it just the fact I've been drinking a bit too much 'Christmas Joy'?

item.title: Holidays: Wonderful Time or Death Trap?

He cums on everything I own.

[/quote]

item.title: Holidays: Wonderful Time or Death Trap?
item.dc:creator: @Cruzer Cruzer
item.description:
@Cruzer wrote:

[quote=“ThAt0n36Uy, post:10, topic:252978”]I love Christmas, my favorite holiday of the year. I love going shopping for gifts for unexpected receivers of those gifts. I love getting to wrap the presents, I love going to the Christmas service on Christmas Eve. I love waking up in the morning with white powdery snow outside on the front lawn, and an immaculate breakfast on the table. Having all of the family over, and visiting.

It’s the best time ever. It’s the one time of year where my family can all gather together and not fight and bicker.[/quote]
i love cumming all over your gifts, your church, and your white powdery snow on your front lawn, and also your immaculate breakfast.

Read full topic

item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

I love Christmas, my favorite holiday of the year. I love going shopping for gifts for unexpected receivers of those gifts. I love getting to wrap the presents, I love going to the Christmas service on Christmas Eve. I love waking up in the morning with white powdery snow outside on the front lawn, and an immaculate breakfast on the table. Having all of the family over, and visiting.

It’s the best time ever. It’s the one time of year where my family can all gather together and not fight and bicker.

item.title: Holidays: Wonderful Time or Death Trap?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Err, I’m not sure if it’s because my family isn’t American, but every christmas I remember, we never do more than a roast. We always have a ton of meat left over(even after boxing day), but for us it’s just roast dinner with christmas pudding for afters.

What’s funny though, is this christmas, it was just me, my mum and my brother. We had no arguments, and even though it may have been a bit dull, it was one of the best christmas’ we’ve had.

Read full topic
item.source: Holidays: Wonderful Time or Death Trap?

item.title: Holidays: Wonderful Time or Death Trap?
item.dc:creator: @King_Redrum King Redrum
item.description:
@King_Redrum wrote:

Eh, well I’m 17 turning 18 in march and I share the same interests as my father and certain other family members; politics, the economy, debating, etc. So it always turns out interesting to me, of course it always ends in an argument usually where neither side will forfeit.

Read full topic
